featured.text: Why does the author quote Blixen’s comment at the end of the third paragraph? (A)
In Blixen’s words, “their weapons and finery are as much a part of their being as are a stag’s antlers” (a male deer’s horns).
Their unique style, as remarked by Karen Blixen, author of Out of Africa, “has grown from the inside, and is an expression of the race and its history.”

definition.zh_def: 布里克森（Blixen）是一位丹麥作家，以其小說和回憶錄而聞名，特別是《非洲的回憶》。
definition.en_def: Blixen is a Danish author known for her novels and memoirs, particularly 'Out of Africa.'
definition.example: Isak Dinesen, whose real name was Karen Blixen, wrote beautifully about her life in Africa.
